content: Investments Career Lifestyle Asked by Billy KoAsked on 08 Jun 2019Hi, thought I share some e-book download sites. Hope this helps you guysHere are a couple of sites which I've come across that offers really good ebooks - those that you find in bookstores. Not sure if it's allowed / legal to share so admins do feel free to take this post down.Just ignore the occasional advert messages within these sites.https://ebook4expert.org/ (Mainly non-fiction)https://t.me/joinchat/AAAAAEpLqHE6Vat-XNI7LA (Trading Books)https://t.me/mfmixebooks (Mix of fiction & Non-fiction)https://t.me/BooksFree4U (Mix of fiction & Non-fiction)5 answersAnswerBump4
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardUpdated on 09 Jun 2019I recommend Overdrive - it allows you to borrow ebooks AND audiobooks from your local public library. For us Singaporeans, this means NLB but it works for our friends overseas too. It's free, since it's a borrowed book.It's legal and you don't need to worry about any shady activities. Fuss free to use.2 comments1
Gabriel Tham09 Jun 2019Oh man i hate the NLB ebook borrowing...ebook also must wait and queue up! What logic is that....Junus Eu09 Jun 2019Usually I'm not in a rush to read books!

See all 3 comments Billy Ko09 Jun 2019Hey Kai Le! I think it is really dependent on the level of competency one has. 

For beginners 
Gone fishing with Buffett 
What I enjoy about this book is how simplified the author makes the theory of investments seem with the usage of analogies.

... (more)Heng Kai Le09 Jun 2019Hey thanks. i'm afraid i'm not at your stage yet. as for now, i like to read others' personal journey in attaining FIRE (financial independence/retire early). some books i enjoyed reading include: Your Money or Your Life (Vicki Robin), Work Optional (Tanja Hester), You Are a Badass at Making Money (Jen Sincero)

i will check out Gone Fishing with Buffett soooon! thanks for replying
Siow NanLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 09 Jun 2019The national library board elibrary app is good too. Borrow for limited time and legal3 comments0

See all 3 comments Gabriel Tham09 Jun 2019Plus, those popular one have to queue...which is stupid considering its an ebook, you technically can have millions of copies but they limit itSiow Nan09 Jun 2019It's not stupid cos you are not paying for the rights to read it. They only have limited digital rights and its paid by taxpayers money. You can always borrow another ebook first while waiting for your desired book
